summary:
Peter: *laying facedown on the floor*
Steve: hey kid, you alright?
Peter: Mr. Captain Steve America Rogers sir?
Steve:...
body:
Peter: *laying facedown on the floor*

Steve: hey kid, you alright?

Peter: Mr. Captain Steve America Rogers sir?

Steve: yes?

Peter: no, not really. Death is inevitable, no one can escape it, so there’s really no point in living, whatsoever

[2 hours later]

Bucky, Tony and Strange: *all discussing what to do*

Bucky: and he just laid right down beside Peter and stayed there!

Strange: should we move them?

Tony: no, no, it’s fine. Peter’s just having an existential crisis and sucked Rogers into it

Bucky: ????

Strange: this isn’t normal

Tony: for the kid it is

@theincorrectavengers

summary: Hi here I am with a prompt. Imagine Peter as an employee in a high end flower shop. He is all sweet and knows tons about flowers...
question: Hi here I am with a prompt. Imagine Peter as an employee in a high end flower shop. He is all sweet and knows tons about flowers and makes beautiful bouquets. Tony comes in really hurried because he is late to a friend date with Pepper (again) or something and wants to get her something to say sorry.  He was going to just grab some roses when he notices Peter making a bouquet. Naturally he has to tall to this pretty boy. Flirting probably ensues.
answer:
Hello! Thanks so much for this prompt, and I’m sorry it’s taken so long!  I’m just gonna post these prompts HC style, because I’m not really in the writing mood right now.  So anyway, I hope you like this cheesy lil’ bit of fluff.

  • Tony is late again and he already feels terrible.  It’s the fifth time in a row he’s running late meeting Pepper and he doesn’t want it to seem like since they broke up he doesn’t care anymore.

  • He asks Happy to stop the car when he spots an elegant little flower shop on the corner of the block.

  • Flowers, he thinks.  It’ll have to do.

  • “I’ll be five minutes max,” he tells Happy as he jumps out of the car and heads into the flower shop.

  • It’s not too busy inside, and as soon as Tony enters his nostrils are assaulted by the strong smell of plant.

  • He isn’t really much of a plant or flower person, but he knows he has to do something to make up for being late again.

  • He walks around for a bit, conscious of the time, and finally settles on grabbing the nearest bouquet of red roses he can find.

  • He gets to the counter to pay for his flowers, and he is met with the most gorgeous deep brown eyes he has ever seen.

  • It takes him aback; fuck this boy is pretty.

  • The cashier - Peter, as his name badge suggests - is making up a bouquet of flowers, and Tony stares at how his slender fingers move so expertly, how his hands are so steady, how his-

  • “Hello, Sir.  How can I help you today?” Peter asks brightly, breaking Tony out of his staring.

  • Tony wants to get to know him.  No, he needs to.  He eyes Peter up and down and smiles charmingly.  “The bouquet you just made up.  Is it for sale?”

  • Peter glances from Tony to his newly-made bouquet and smiles.  “Yeah,” he says.  “Sure.  It’s $15.”

  • Tony hums and nods.  “I’ll take them.  And these,” he says, placing the roses on the counter.

  • “Of course, Sir,” Peter says, keying things into the till and then carefully picking up his hand-made bouquet and placing it on the counter for Tony.  “Very lucky someone you’ve got at home.”

  • “Oh yeah,” Tony agrees.  “Very lucky.”

  • “That’ll be 24.99 altogether,” Peter says, smiling so sweetly at Tony that Tony thinks his heart might explode.

  • Tony pulls out a 50 dollar bill and hands it to Peter.  “Keep the change,” he says softly. 

  • Peter stares at Tony in shock, which makes Tony smile.  Just as Peter’s about to protest, Tony puts his hand up and cuts in.  “Please, Peter,” he says, watching the boy blush at the use of his name.  “Keep the change.  For the effort of having to make the bouquet.”

  • “Th-thank you.  That’s really nice of you, Sir,” Peter says, cheeks still rosy.  “Let me get your receipt.”

  • “Of course.”

  • When Peter hands the receipt to Tony, Tony pulls a pen out of the pocket of his suit and writes his phone number down on the paper.  He then takes the roses in one hand and slides Peter’s bouquet back across the counter towards Peter.

  • “For you,” Tony grins.  “The most beautiful flowers I’ve ever seen for the most beautiful man I’ve ever seen.”  He slides the receipt across to a blushing, stuttering Peter and winks.  “And now you’ve got my number.  Your move.”

  • “Sir, I-”

  • “-Call me Tony.  Tony Stark,” Tony says with a smile.  “It was lovely meeting you, Peter.  I hope to hear from you soon?” With that, Tony walks towards the door of the shop, feeling thoroughly elated.

  • “Yes, Mr Stark.  You- You will!” he hears Peter call after him.  

  • All in all, a pretty successful day.  And a good reason to be late.

summary:
The gang at the compound: 
Peter talking about using his web shooters for the first time: So I just like, jumped off a building...
body:
The gang at the compound:


Peter talking about using his web shooters for the first time: So I just like, jumped off a building and hoped for the best. And that was how I learned how to swing.

Tony: And this is why I’m going grey.


*this was funnier in my head*

summary: Amen to your last post! But woah, in what storyline does Tony Stark sic a bunch of super villains on our beleaguered hero? What...
question: Amen to your last post! But woah, in what storyline does Tony Stark sic a bunch of super villains on our beleaguered hero? What happened there?!
answer:
Canon 616 – Civil War. Peter initially joins Tony’s side of the war (which, btw was a full fledged war, not an argument as seen in the movies) only to later switch sides after registering under the superhero registration act, and thus having to reveal his identity to the world. It f@cks up his life and he realizes he made a mistake. Tony isn’t happy about him switching sides and they both battle it out. Tony later sends some bad guys out to hurt him. He’s nearly beaten to death and only saved by the Punisher, who takes him back to Captain America and his hiding place for treatment.

It’s worth noting Tony Stark is really the asshole in this storyline as opposed to the movies where Steve is made out to be the bad guy. Honestly? Just my opinion – Tony Stark is really an ass in all the comics. It’s cool if you like him and disagree, I just could never get into him with how they write his personality. RDJ really brought empathy to the character.

Feel free to ask any other Spidey questions, I’m a walking encyclopedia, lol.

summary: This is for @sweetlysilent‘s 6k Writing Challenge! The prompt was “You wanna know the worst part? I loved you anyway.” and I...
body:
This is for @sweetlysilent‘s 6k Writing Challenge! The prompt was “You wanna know the worst part? I loved you anyway.” and I chose College!Roommate!Peter.

Word count: 2.2k (this was longer than I expected, not gonna lie)

Warnings: A little swearing, my terrible terrible angst. Low-key fluff.










You dropped your bags at the door. NYU. You had made it.

You were from London originally, but it was your dream to study in New York and you had finally worked your ass off and got a scholarship. You had no friends or family in New York, but you had a dorm on campus.

You started to unpack, putting up posters with Blu-Tac and putting books onto the shelf above your bed. You put your own bedding onto the bed, and put your laptop onto the desk along with all your folders. It was only when you turned around that you noticed the other half of the room.

You had signed up for a roommate, figuring it was an easy way to make a friend, and clearly she had already moved in. There was a Star Wars poster on the wall. Clothes were spread on the bed - sweaters and jeans. A backpack lay forgotten at the foot of the bed. The desk was covered in books and folders. You glanced at them.

Peter Parker, read the handwritten labels.

Was your new roommate a boy?

You called Alexandra, your best friend from London.

‘Y/N! How is it?’

‘It’s amazing. It’s so pretty, and it’s right next to Washington Square Park, and…’ you gushed about the university.

‘Wow! So, you met any cute American boys yet?’

You snorted. ‘Alex, I’ve literally just stepped foot into my dorm. I haven’t even met my roommate yet!’

‘Ooh, who’s she?’

‘He,’ you said. ‘His name’s Peter. He’s… Messy.’

Alex laughed. ‘Of course miss clean freak gets stuck with a messy roommate. Also, a boy!’

‘Calm down, Alex. He could be a terrible person for all I know, alright? I’m gonna go explore, but I’ll call you later.’

You ended the call. Just as you were about to leave the dorm room, the window opened. A boy jumped through, wearing a big old yellow coat and sweatpants. His shoes were bright red and blue, peeking out from under his coat. The boy froze.

‘Oh! Um, you must be Y/N. I’m Peter,’ said the boy.

You laughed nervously. ‘So, um, what’s with the outfit?’ you asked. ‘And the, uh, the window?’

There was utter silence. Peter swallowed.

‘So…’ he rubbed the back of his neck awkwardly. ‘You know Spider-Man?’

You had been a super-fan of Spider-Man since he first appeared, but you weren’t about to tell Peter about the hours spent nagging your parents to drop you off in Queens so you could stalk him. Spider-Man, that is, not Peter.

‘Yeah, I know him. What about him?’ you tilted your head. Peter wouldn’t meet your eyes.

‘I’m- uh, I mean- I’m…’ he stopped and took a deep breath. ‘I’m part of a fanclub,’ he blurted out. ‘A Spider-Man fanclub. We meet in Washington Square Park once a week, and we… we cosplay and stuff.’

Peter unzipped his coat to reveal a Spider-Man suit. Damn, the guy had muscles. You looked up to meet his eyes.

‘Why did you come in through the window?’ you asked.

‘Authenticity,’ he replied instantly.

‘Wow, you’re a nerd,’ you snorted.

‘And you didn’t get that from the Star Wars poster?’ Peter grinned.

‘Fair,’ you smiled at him. ‘I’m going out, I’ll see you later.’

You paused at the door before winking and adding, ‘Spider-Man.’

Peter stood, frozen, staring at the door. He didn’t think his roommate would arrive until later. And now he had lied to her. It would have been easier if he had just said he was Spider-Man. She probably wouldn’t have believed him anyway. Still, the fanclub thing was a good cover. Right?

You arrived back late. Peter was sitting on his bed, watching something on his laptop.

‘What’cha watching?’ you asked. He jumped.

‘Oh, uh, just a movie.’

‘What movie?’

‘Alien,’ he replied. ‘It’s- uh, I’ve seen it a bunch of times but I love it.’

‘I’ve never seen that,’ you replied.

‘You haven’t?’ his eyes widened. ‘Hey, uh, sit down!’

You sat next to him on the bed. He was blushing as he unpaused the movie.

You woke up. It was past midnight. You were in your own bed, still fully dressed. You put two and two together and realised that Peter must have moved you when you fell asleep. Peter was on his own bed, deep in concentration. He was scribbling in a notebook and stirring some kind of liquid. He poured the liquid into a tiny capsule and slid it into something on his wrist. He aimed at the ceiling. A long string of white fluid sprayed from his wrist and stuck to the ceiling, like… Like a spider’s web.

You rolled over and went back to sleep.

You and Peter became friends quickly, even though he was always disappearing. He said it was for debate club, chess club and the Spider-Man fanclub. Once or twice you had asked to join the fanclub. He had blushed deeply and said that it was ‘an all-male fanclub’. You had rolled your eyes and given up. You watched a movie together almost every night. Sometimes Peter invited Ned, one of his friends from high school, over to your dorm. Peter had given no indication that he had a girlfriend. Or, for that matter, any friends other than Ned. All your friends were back in England, so you were grateful for Ned coming over. You and Ned hung out without Peter if Peter disappeared.

It was a Friday night. You had finished an essay for English lit, and you were hanging out, watching Roman Holiday with Ned.

‘You’re single, right?’ asked Ned suddenly.

‘You asking me out?’ you joked. ‘But yeah, I am.’

‘Not asking you out,’ Ned grinned with a laugh. ‘Just wondering.’

The days spun by, and soon it was half-term. You were staying in the dorm for the week, excited for a chance to actually hang out in New York without having to worry about work. You had a job in a café and plans to explore the city.

You were finishing off your week’s assignment, the only work you had due for after the half-term, when the window opened. This was a regular occurrence at this point - Peter used the window more than the door. His footsteps landed heavily on the floor.

‘Hey, Peter,’ you greeted, not looking up. Peter said nothing. His breath was coming out in short gasps. You looked up.

Peter, still in his Spider-Man suit, was bleeding. His entire side had been slashed, and the blood was coming out in sheets. Your brain flooded with blind panic.

‘Fuck!’ you yelled. ‘Peter, what the hell?’

You grabbed your phone.

‘No,’ slurred Peter. ‘Don’t call Ambl…. ambu….ambulance, call May…’

You grabbed Peter’s phone and pressed on his aunt’s number, which was at the top of his emergency contacts.

‘May?’ you snapped. ‘Is this Peter’s aunt? I’m Y/N, Peter’s roommate. He’s been stabbed.’

‘I’ll be right there,’ May’s voice was calm, even, and didn’t sound even remotely shocked. ‘Keep talking to him. Ask him what happened, his name, birthday, what he had for breakfast, anything. Keep him conscious. Apply pressure to the wound, try and slow the bleeding.’

She hung up.

‘Peter, what happened?’ you asked.

‘Car thief,’ Peter’s voice was soft and tired. ‘Knife. I tried to web him, and he lashed out.’

‘What?’ you frowned. ‘Peter, what happened to fanclub? Where were you? Why were you trying to… web him?’

The pieces clicked together.

Peter coming in through the window, dressed as Spider-Man.

The all-male fanclub that you weren’t allowed to join.

The time you had woken up and seen him experimenting with that white goop.

Peter was Spider-Man.

‘Oh, yeah,’ Peter slurred. ‘I forgot you didn’t know… I’m Spider- Spider-Man.’

‘Okay, good to, good to know,’ you stuttered. You asked him a few basic questions, and then there was a knock on the door.

Peter’s Aunt May stood, armed with a first-aid kit and a steely expression. She strode over to Peter, lying on the floor.

‘Whassup, May?’

‘Don’t ‘whassup’ me, Peter,’ May sighed. She grabbed some rubbing alcohol and bandages. ‘If we can slow the bleeding, your body will take care of the rest.’

‘Y/N,’ murmured Peter.

‘Yeah?’

‘Sorry for wrecking your carpet,’ he slurred. You realised he had bled all over your white rug.

‘It’s alright, Peter,’ you shook your head with a smile.

Time sped by. Now that you knew Peter’s secret, the two of you had grown even closer. You watched countless movies, went shopping for dorm stuff, and helped each other study.

You had by now accepted the fact that you had a crush on him.

But you were fine. He didn’t like you back - why would he? None of your other crushes ever had, so why would this one be any different? It was a crush, that’s all. And crushes pass.

But this felt different. Whenever he wasn’t around, you found yourself looking over to see his reaction to something you said, before realising he wasn’t there. You remembered little details - the name of his childhood pet, his favourite movie, his dad’s name.

It was your second semester of the year. You were sitting on your bed, typing an essay. You heard the window open. Peter’s footsteps landed heavily on the ground.

‘Hey, Peter, how was patrol?’

‘It was - yeah,’ Peter sighed. You heard him hiss as he took off his mask, and you looked up.

Peter’s face was bleeding.

‘Shit, Peter, not again,’ you got up and grabbed the first-aid kit. ‘You’ve gotta be more careful.’

‘Can’t help it,’ he mumbled. ‘They came from behind. Swiss army knife.’

You took a deep breath, cleaning Peter’s wound. ‘Peter, it- it stresses me out, okay? When you leave, and I don’t know when you’ll be back, or if you’ll be okay, or…’

‘Really?’

‘Yeah, Peter. I’m worried about you.’

Peter’s expression stiffened. ‘I can take care of myself, you know.’

‘I know that, Peter, I just… I get scared.’

‘Well, you don’t need to get scared, alright? I’m fine. I’m an adult.’

‘And yet I’m the one that takes care of your wounds.’

‘I never asked you to help.’

‘Peter, you came home and fucking bled out on my floor, okay? You need my help.’

‘No,’ Peter stood up just as you placed a plaster on his cut. ‘I don’t need your help, Y/N. And I don’t fucking want it, either.’

You felt shaky. Like you were about to cry. ‘Good luck cleaning your wounds when you’re unconscious, Parker.’

‘Like I said, I’m an adult,’ Peter was at the door now. ‘I can take care of my own fucking wounds.’

You felt a tear slip down your face. ‘Peter, I -’ your voice cracked.

Peter turned to face you, looking surprised.

‘What?’ he asked.

‘You go out every night, okay? And I never know if you’re gonna come back with a stab wound or a bullet wound. And I get so - so fucking scared every time you leave. And… I just- You know what the worst part is? Sometimes you’re a fucking asshole, okay? But the worst part is… I just… I love you anyway.’

Peter froze. You realised what you had just said. Peter’s eyes lit up with… something?

‘I - I mean, as- as a friend,’ you stuttered, laughing it off.

Peter’s face fell slightly. ‘I- I have to go.’

Ten minutes later, your phone buzzed.

Ned: y/n what the hell did you do to peter

You: nothing what’s wrong?

Ned: he’s crying his eyes out

You: what? I’m coming over

Ned: no dont he just asked me not to invite you over

You: has he said anything

Ned: he said you had said that you loved him as a friend

Ned: oh shit he just said not to tell you any of this

Ned: he just said he loves you

Ned: as more than a friend

You: what??? Holy shit

You: tell him i said i like him back

Ned: WHAT? YOU DO?

Ned: why’d you say you only loved him as a friend

You: i didn’t think he felt the same way

Ned: i’m telling him to go back to the dorm room

Ned: he’s on his way to the dorm now

You slumped on your bed, utterly confused. Peter was crying? Because of you? And he…. Loved you? No. That - Ned had made a mistake.

There was a soft knock on the door.

‘Y/N?’ asked Peter. ‘Can I - come in?’

‘Sure,’ you replied. Peter walked in. ‘Ned told me what you said,’ you told him. Peter froze. His eyes were still blotchy. He swallowed.

‘Uh, what- what did I say?’

‘That, you- that you, uh, that… That you loved me.’

‘Oh,’ Peter laughed bitterly, looking down. ‘That.’

‘Peter, it’s-’

‘It’s nothing. You don’t feel the same way. Can we still be friends?’

‘Peter, I-’

‘Y/N, it’s fine. Can we drop it?’

‘Peter, I do feel the same way.’

Peter was in the middle of hanging his coat up on the door. The coat slipped from his fingers and landed on the floor.

‘You- what?’

‘I didn’t tell you because I didn’t think you felt the same way. I said that I loved you, you looked surprised, so I lied and said it was just as a friend. Peter, I love you, alright? No matter how many times you get stabbed.’

‘I love you too, Y/N.’

You ended the call. Just as you were about to leave the dorm room, the window opened. A boy jumped through, wearing a big old yellow coat and sweatpants. His shoes were bright red and blue, peeking out from under his coat. The boy froze.

‘Oh! Um, you must be Y/N. I’m Peter,’ said the boy.

You laughed nervously. ‘So, um, what’s with the outfit?’ you asked. ‘And the, uh, the window?’

There was utter silence. Peter swallowed.

‘So…’ he rubbed the back of his neck awkwardly. ‘You know Spider-Man?’

[[MORE]]

You had been a super-fan of Spider-Man since he first appeared, but you weren’t about to tell Peter about the hours spent nagging your parents to drop you off in Queens so you could stalk him. Spider-Man, that is, not Peter.

‘Yeah, I know him. What about him?’ you tilted your head. Peter wouldn’t meet your eyes.

‘I’m- uh, I mean- I’m…’ he stopped and took a deep breath. ‘I’m part of a fanclub,’ he blurted out. ‘A Spider-Man fanclub. We meet in Washington Square Park once a week, and we… we cosplay and stuff.’

Peter unzipped his coat to reveal a Spider-Man suit. Damn, the guy had muscles. You looked up to meet his eyes.

‘Why did you come in through the window?’ you asked.

‘Authenticity,’ he replied instantly.

‘Wow, you’re a nerd,’ you snorted.

‘And you didn’t get that from the Star Wars poster?’ Peter grinned.

‘Fair,’ you smiled at him. ‘I’m going out, I’ll see you later.’

You paused at the door before winking and adding, ‘Spider-Man.’

Peter stood, frozen, staring at the door. He didn’t think his roommate would arrive until later. And now he had lied to her. It would have been easier if he had just said he was Spider-Man. She probably wouldn’t have believed him anyway. Still, the fanclub thing was a good cover. Right?

You arrived back late. Peter was sitting on his bed, watching something on his laptop.

‘What’cha watching?’ you asked. He jumped.

‘Oh, uh, just a movie.’

‘What movie?’

‘Alien,’ he replied. ‘It’s- uh, I’ve seen it a bunch of times but I love it.’

‘I’ve never seen that,’ you replied.

‘You haven’t?’ his eyes widened. ‘Hey, uh, sit down!’

You sat next to him on the bed. He was blushing as he unpaused the movie.

You woke up. It was past midnight. You were in your own bed, still fully dressed. You put two and two together and realised that Peter must have moved you when you fell asleep. Peter was on his own bed, deep in concentration. He was scribbling in a notebook and stirring some kind of liquid. He poured the liquid into a tiny capsule and slid it into something on his wrist. He aimed at the ceiling. A long string of white fluid sprayed from his wrist and stuck to the ceiling, like… Like a spider’s web.

You rolled over and went back to sleep.

You and Peter became friends quickly, even though he was always disappearing. He said it was for debate club, chess club and the Spider-Man fanclub. Once or twice you had asked to join the fanclub. He had blushed deeply and said that it was ‘an all-male fanclub’. You had rolled your eyes and given up. You watched a movie together almost every night. Sometimes Peter invited Ned, one of his friends from high school, over to your dorm. Peter had given no indication that he had a girlfriend. Or, for that matter, any friends other than Ned. All your friends were back in England, so you were grateful for Ned coming over. You and Ned hung out without Peter if Peter disappeared.

It was a Friday night. You had finished an essay for English lit, and you were hanging out, watching Roman Holiday with Ned.

‘You’re single, right?’ asked Ned suddenly.

‘You asking me out?’ you joked. ‘But yeah, I am.’

‘Not asking you out,’ Ned grinned with a laugh. ‘Just wondering.’

The days spun by, and soon it was half-term. You were staying in the dorm for the week, excited for a chance to actually hang out in New York without having to worry about work. You had a job in a café and plans to explore the city.

You were finishing off your week’s assignment, the only work you had due for after the half-term, when the window opened. This was a regular occurrence at this point - Peter used the window more than the door. His footsteps landed heavily on the floor.

‘Hey, Peter,’ you greeted, not looking up. Peter said nothing. His breath was coming out in short gasps. You looked up.

Peter, still in his Spider-Man suit, was bleeding. His entire side had been slashed, and the blood was coming out in sheets. Your brain flooded with blind panic.

‘Fuck!’ you yelled. ‘Peter, what the hell?’

You grabbed your phone.

‘No,’ slurred Peter. ‘Don’t call Ambl…. ambu….ambulance, call May…’

You grabbed Peter’s phone and pressed on his aunt’s number, which was at the top of his emergency contacts.

‘May?’ you snapped. ‘Is this Peter’s aunt? I’m Y/N, Peter’s roommate. He’s been stabbed.’

‘I’ll be right there,’ May’s voice was calm, even, and didn’t sound even remotely shocked. ‘Keep talking to him. Ask him what happened, his name, birthday, what he had for breakfast, anything. Keep him conscious. Apply pressure to the wound, try and slow the bleeding.’

She hung up.

‘Peter, what happened?’ you asked.

‘Car thief,’ Peter’s voice was soft and tired. ‘Knife. I tried to web him, and he lashed out.’

‘What?’ you frowned. ‘Peter, what happened to fanclub? Where were you? Why were you trying to… web him?’

The pieces clicked together.

Peter coming in through the window, dressed as Spider-Man.

The all-male fanclub that you weren’t allowed to join.

The time you had woken up and seen him experimenting with that white goop.

Peter was Spider-Man.

‘Oh, yeah,’ Peter slurred. ‘I forgot you didn’t know… I’m Spider- Spider-Man.’

‘Okay, good to, good to know,’ you stuttered. You asked him a few basic questions, and then there was a knock on the door.

Peter’s Aunt May stood, armed with a first-aid kit and a steely expression. She strode over to Peter, lying on the floor.

‘Whassup, May?’

‘Don’t ‘whassup’ me, Peter,’ May sighed. She grabbed some rubbing alcohol and bandages. ‘If we can slow the bleeding, your body will take care of the rest.’

‘Y/N,’ murmured Peter.

‘Yeah?’

‘Sorry for wrecking your carpet,’ he slurred. You realised he had bled all over your white rug.

‘It’s alright, Peter,’ you shook your head with a smile.

Time sped by. Now that you knew Peter’s secret, the two of you had grown even closer. You watched countless movies, went shopping for dorm stuff, and helped each other study.

You had by now accepted the fact that you had a crush on him.

But you were fine. He didn’t like you back - why would he? None of your other crushes ever had, so why would this one be any different? It was a crush, that’s all. And crushes pass.

But this felt different. Whenever he wasn’t around, you found yourself looking over to see his reaction to something you said, before realising he wasn’t there. You remembered little details - the name of his childhood pet, his favourite movie, his dad’s name.

It was your second semester of the year. You were sitting on your bed, typing an essay. You heard the window open. Peter’s footsteps landed heavily on the ground.

‘Hey, Peter, how was patrol?’

‘It was - yeah,’ Peter sighed. You heard him hiss as he took off his mask, and you looked up.

Peter’s face was bleeding.

‘Shit, Peter, not again,’ you got up and grabbed the first-aid kit. ‘You’ve gotta be more careful.’

‘Can’t help it,’ he mumbled. ‘They came from behind. Swiss army knife.’

You took a deep breath, cleaning Peter’s wound. ‘Peter, it- it stresses me out, okay? When you leave, and I don’t know when you’ll be back, or if you’ll be okay, or…’

‘Really?’

‘Yeah, Peter. I’m worried about you.’

Peter’s expression stiffened. ‘I can take care of myself, you know.’

‘I know that, Peter, I just… I get scared.’

‘Well, you don’t need to get scared, alright? I’m fine. I’m an adult.’

‘And yet I’m the one that takes care of your wounds.’

‘I never asked you to help.’

‘Peter, you came home and fucking bled out on my floor, okay? You need my help.’

‘No,’ Peter stood up just as you placed a plaster on his cut. ‘I don’t need your help, Y/N. And I don’t fucking want it, either.’

You felt shaky. Like you were about to cry. ‘Good luck cleaning your wounds when you’re unconscious, Parker.’

‘Like I said, I’m an adult,’ Peter was at the door now. ‘I can take care of my own fucking wounds.’

You felt a tear slip down your face. ‘Peter, I -’ your voice cracked.

Peter turned to face you, looking surprised.

‘What?’ he asked.

‘You go out every night, okay? And I never know if you’re gonna come back with a stab wound or a bullet wound. And I get so - so fucking scared every time you leave. And… I just- You know what the worst part is? Sometimes you’re a fucking asshole, okay? But the worst part is… I just… I love you anyway.’

Peter froze. You realised what you had just said. Peter’s eyes lit up with… something?

‘I - I mean, as- as a friend,’ you stuttered, laughing it off.

Peter’s face fell slightly. ‘I- I have to go.’

Ten minutes later, your phone buzzed.

Ned: as more than a friend

Ned: he’s on his way to the dorm now

You slumped on your bed, utterly confused. Peter was crying? Because of you? And he…. Loved you? No. That - Ned had made a mistake.

There was a soft knock on the door.

‘Y/N?’ asked Peter. ‘Can I - come in?’

‘Sure,’ you replied. Peter walked in. ‘Ned told me what you said,’ you told him. Peter froze. His eyes were still blotchy. He swallowed.

‘Uh, what- what did I say?’

‘That, you- that you, uh, that… That you loved me.’

‘Oh,’ Peter laughed bitterly, looking down. ‘That.’

‘Peter, it’s-’

‘It’s nothing. You don’t feel the same way. Can we still be friends?’

‘Peter, I-’

‘Y/N, it’s fine. Can we drop it?’

‘Peter, I do feel the same way.’

Peter was in the middle of hanging his coat up on the door. The coat slipped from his fingers and landed on the floor.

‘You- what?’

‘I didn’t tell you because I didn’t think you felt the same way. I said that I loved you, you looked surprised, so I lied and said it was just as a friend. Peter, I love you, alright? No matter how many times you get stabbed.’

‘I love you too, Y/N.’

It was a Friday night. You had finished an essay for English lit, and you were hanging out, watching Roman Holiday with Ned.

‘You’re single, right?’ asked Ned suddenly.

‘You asking me out?’ you joked. ‘But yeah, I am.’

‘Not asking you out,’ Ned grinned with a laugh. ‘Just wondering.’

The days spun by, and soon it was half-term. You were staying in the dorm for the week, excited for a chance to actually hang out in New York without having to worry about work. You had a job in a café and plans to explore the city.

You were finishing off your week’s assignment, the only work you had due for after the half-term, when the window opened. This was a regular occurrence at this point - Peter used the window more than the door. His footsteps landed heavily on the floor.

‘Hey, Peter,’ you greeted, not looking up. Peter said nothing. His breath was coming out in short gasps. You looked up.

Peter, still in his Spider-Man suit, was bleeding. His entire side had been slashed, and the blood was coming out in sheets. Your brain flooded with blind panic.

‘Fuck!’ you yelled. ‘Peter, what the hell?’

You grabbed your phone.

‘No,’ slurred Peter. ‘Don’t call Ambl…. ambu….ambulance, call May…’

You grabbed Peter’s phone and pressed on his aunt’s number, which was at the top of his emergency contacts.

‘May?’ you snapped. ‘Is this Peter’s aunt? I’m Y/N, Peter’s roommate. He’s been stabbed.’

‘I’ll be right there,’ May’s voice was calm, even, and didn’t sound even remotely shocked. ‘Keep talking to him. Ask him what happened, his name, birthday, what he had for breakfast, anything. Keep him conscious. Apply pressure to the wound, try and slow the bleeding.’

She hung up.

‘Peter, what happened?’ you asked.

‘Car thief,’ Peter’s voice was soft and tired. ‘Knife. I tried to web him, and he lashed out.’

‘What?’ you frowned. ‘Peter, what happened to fanclub? Where were you? Why were you trying to… web him?’

The pieces clicked together.

Peter coming in through the window, dressed as Spider-Man.

The all-male fanclub that you weren’t allowed to join.

The time you had woken up and seen him experimenting with that white goop.

Peter was Spider-Man.

‘Oh, yeah,’ Peter slurred. ‘I forgot you didn’t know… I’m Spider- Spider-Man.’

‘Okay, good to, good to know,’ you stuttered. You asked him a few basic questions, and then there was a knock on the door.

Peter’s Aunt May stood, armed with a first-aid kit and a steely expression. She strode over to Peter, lying on the floor.

‘Whassup, May?’

‘Don’t ‘whassup’ me, Peter,’ May sighed. She grabbed some rubbing alcohol and bandages. ‘If we can slow the bleeding, your body will take care of the rest.’

‘Y/N,’ murmured Peter.

‘Yeah?’

‘Sorry for wrecking your carpet,’ he slurred. You realised he had bled all over your white rug.

‘It’s alright, Peter,’ you shook your head with a smile.

Time sped by. Now that you knew Peter’s secret, the two of you had grown even closer. You watched countless movies, went shopping for dorm stuff, and helped each other study.

You had by now accepted the fact that you had a crush on him.

But you were fine. He didn’t like you back - why would he? None of your other crushes ever had, so why would this one be any different? It was a crush, that’s all. And crushes pass.

But this felt different. Whenever he wasn’t around, you found yourself looking over to see his reaction to something you said, before realising he wasn’t there. You remembered little details - the name of his childhood pet, his favourite movie, his dad’s name.

It was your second semester of the year. You were sitting on your bed, typing an essay. You heard the window open. Peter’s footsteps landed heavily on the ground.

‘Hey, Peter, how was patrol?’

‘It was - yeah,’ Peter sighed. You heard him hiss as he took off his mask, and you looked up.

Peter’s face was bleeding.

‘Shit, Peter, not again,’ you got up and grabbed the first-aid kit. ‘You’ve gotta be more careful.’

‘Can’t help it,’ he mumbled. ‘They came from behind. Swiss army knife.’

You took a deep breath, cleaning Peter’s wound. ‘Peter, it- it stresses me out, okay? When you leave, and I don’t know when you’ll be back, or if you’ll be okay, or…’

‘Really?’

‘Yeah, Peter. I’m worried about you.’

Peter’s expression stiffened. ‘I can take care of myself, you know.’

‘I know that, Peter, I just… I get scared.’

‘Well, you don’t need to get scared, alright? I’m fine. I’m an adult.’

‘And yet I’m the one that takes care of your wounds.’

‘I never asked you to help.’

‘Peter, you came home and fucking bled out on my floor, okay? You need my help.’

‘No,’ Peter stood up just as you placed a plaster on his cut. ‘I don’t need your help, Y/N. And I don’t fucking want it, either.’

You felt shaky. Like you were about to cry. ‘Good luck cleaning your wounds when you’re unconscious, Parker.’

‘Like I said, I’m an adult,’ Peter was at the door now. ‘I can take care of my own fucking wounds.’

You felt a tear slip down your face. ‘Peter, I -’ your voice cracked.

Peter turned to face you, looking surprised.

‘What?’ he asked.

‘You go out every night, okay? And I never know if you’re gonna come back with a stab wound or a bullet wound. And I get so - so fucking scared every time you leave. And… I just- You know what the worst part is? Sometimes you’re a fucking asshole, okay? But the worst part is… I just… I love you anyway.’

Peter froze. You realised what you had just said. Peter’s eyes lit up with… something?

‘I - I mean, as- as a friend,’ you stuttered, laughing it off.

Peter’s face fell slightly. ‘I- I have to go.’

Ten minutes later, your phone buzzed.

Ned: y/n what the hell did you do to peter

You: nothing what’s wrong?

Ned: he’s crying his eyes out

You: what? I’m coming over

Ned: no dont he just asked me not to invite you over

You: has he said anything

Ned: he said you had said that you loved him as a friend

Ned: oh shit he just said not to tell you any of this

Ned: he just said he loves you

Ned: as more than a friend

You: what??? Holy shit

You: tell him i said i like him back

Ned: WHAT? YOU DO?

Ned: why’d you say you only loved him as a friend

You: i didn’t think he felt the same way

Ned: i’m telling him to go back to the dorm room

Ned: he’s on his way to the dorm now

You slumped on your bed, utterly confused. Peter was crying? Because of you? And he…. Loved you? No. That - Ned had made a mistake.

There was a soft knock on the door.

‘Y/N?’ asked Peter. ‘Can I - come in?’

‘Sure,’ you replied. Peter walked in. ‘Ned told me what you said,’ you told him. Peter froze. His eyes were still blotchy. He swallowed.

‘Uh, what- what did I say?’

‘That, you- that you, uh, that… That you loved me.’

‘Oh,’ Peter laughed bitterly, looking down. ‘That.’

‘Peter, it’s-’

‘It’s nothing. You don’t feel the same way. Can we still be friends?’

‘Peter, I-’

‘Y/N, it’s fine. Can we drop it?’

‘Peter, I do feel the same way.’

Peter was in the middle of hanging his coat up on the door. The coat slipped from his fingers and landed on the floor.

‘You- what?’

‘I didn’t tell you because I didn’t think you felt the same way. I said that I loved you, you looked surprised, so I lied and said it was just as a friend. Peter, I love you, alright? No matter how many times you get stabbed.’

‘I love you too, Y/N.’
trail.content_abstract:
This is for @sweetlysilent‘s 6k Writing Challenge! The prompt was “You wanna know the worst part? I loved you anyway.” and I chose College!Roommate!Peter.

Word count: 2.2k (this was longer than I expected, not gonna lie)

Warnings: A little swearing, my terrible terrible angst. Low-key fluff.










You dropped your bags at the door. NYU. You had made it.

You were from London originally, but it was your dream to study in New York and you had finally worked your ass off and got a scholarship. You had no friends or family in New York, but you had a dorm on campus.

You started to unpack, putting up posters with Blu-Tac and putting books onto the shelf above your bed. You put your own bedding onto the bed, and put your laptop onto the desk along with all your folders. It was only when you turned around that you noticed the other half of the room.

You had signed up for a roommate, figuring it was an easy way to make a friend, and clearly she had already moved in. There was a Star Wars poster on the wall. Clothes were spread on the bed - sweaters and jeans. A backpack lay forgotten at the foot of the bed. The desk was covered in books and folders. You glanced at them.

Peter Parker, read the handwritten labels.

Was your new roommate a boy?

You called Alexandra, your best friend from London.

‘Y/N! How is it?’

‘It’s amazing. It’s so pretty, and it’s right next to Washington Square Park, and…’ you gushed about the university.

‘Wow! So, you met any cute American boys yet?’

You snorted. ‘Alex, I’ve literally just stepped foot into my dorm. I haven’t even met my roommate yet!’

‘Ooh, who’s she?’

‘He,’ you said. ‘His name’s Peter. He’s… Messy.’

Alex laughed. ‘Of course miss clean freak gets stuck with a messy roommate. Also, a boy!’

‘Calm down, Alex. He could be a terrible person for all I know, alright? I’m gonna go explore, but I’ll call you later.’

You ended the call. Just as you were about to leave the dorm room, the window opened. A boy jumped through, wearing a big old yellow coat and sweatpants. His shoes were bright red and blue, peeking out from under his coat. The boy froze.

‘Oh! Um, you must be Y/N. I’m Peter,’ said the boy.

You laughed nervously. ‘So, um, what’s with the outfit?’ you asked. ‘And the, uh, the window?’

There was utter silence. Peter swallowed.

‘So…’ he rubbed the back of his neck awkwardly. ‘You know Spider-Man?’

summary: The first day of school was today. Since the accident I had been homeschooled. I was going to go to school at the beginning of...
body:
Part 5 of Water Goddess: A Peter Parker imagine

The first day of school was today. Since the accident I had been homeschooled. I was going to go to school at the beginning of the year but my panic attacks had gotten so bad that I was forced to stay home another two months. I was really excited. I took my own car which Tony had just given me it was an amazing red convertible; everyone’s dream car. As I pulled up people stared, most of them knew who I was. I hopped out of the car and headed towards the entrance.

I made my way to the principal’s office. Since I was joining in the middle of the year I was getting a tour. As I walked people watched me. Most whispered to their friends and many more pointed at me. My heart began to speed up and I had to force my head to look at the floor.

“Hi y/n, I’m Mr. Morita.” the principle said when I walked into the front office.

    “Hi” I said.

“Y/n, this is Clara she is going to show you around.” he said.

“Hi y/n.” said a pretty girl standing next to Mr. Morita.

“Hey.” I said.

“All right let’s start the tour.”

Clara was really nice she helped me find my locker and showed me around then I headed to my first class. Throughout the day people came up to me and asked if I wanted to sit with them at lunch. Guys hit on me and girls were desperate to become my friend. I hated it. They only cared about who my uncle was not who I was.

At lunch I didn’t know where to sit so I went to the library to check out some books. I walked in and looked and all the shelves. It made me happy knowing that I would never run out of books. I found the horror section and then looked for the S’s when I found them I instantly grabbed every Stephen King book that I hadn’t read I looked at my stack and decided to begin with “Different Seasons” a short story book.

    I went to the library clerk who checked out my books then caring all of them with Different Seasons open on top I walked back to the cafeteria intending to sit in a corner reading the rest of lunch. I was too busy reading to notice anything around me as I turned a corner I ran straight into someone. We both hit the ground books scattered everywhere.

    “Oh sorry I wasn’t paying attention.” I stammered I said wiping my forehead to reveal a streak of blood “Shit.”

    The boy I had run into was kinda cute. He had curly brown hair and almond brown eyes. His jawline was sharp and precise. He looked up and seemed startled to see me. “A-are you ok” he managed to get out.

    “Yeah I’m fine thanks, the corner of one of the books just hit my head” I replied “you really don’t have to help I wasn’t paying attention” I said as the boy helped picked up my books.

    “Its no problem” he said “I’m Peter by the way.” he said looking up at me. His smile was contagious.

“I’m y/n.” I replied my lips breaking into a smile, “Sorry again Peter.”

“It’s fine.” he said “Hope your head is ok.”

“Thanks, see you around.” I said taking my books from him.

Peters P.O.V

I was heading to Mrs. Kyler’s room when I ran straight into someone coming around the corner. Books scattered everywhere and I was knocked to the ground. So was the girl. She began apologizing as she did I began to pick up the books. I looked up at her and was startled to see y/n. She looked even more beautiful today then she did last night. her eyes were shining, her hair hanging effortlessly around her shoulders. I could tell she barely tried and still looked amazing. Then I saw the blood on her forehead. “Are you ok?” I asked as calmly as possible.

“Yeah I’m fine thanks, the corner of one of the books just hit my head” She said “you really don’t have to help I wasn’t paying attention” She told me.

“It’s fine” I was trying to look down to keep from staring at her. “I’m Peter by the way.”

“I’m y/n.” She replied her smile made me feel light headed, “Sorry again Peter.”

“It’s fine.” I said “Hope your head is ok.”

“Thanks, see you around.” She took her books from me. I watched walk away in amazement. I could feel my heart beating fast again.

body:
(Peter and Ned have found Tony’s journal from when he was young)

Tony: You guys have fun.

Peter: Oh, we will.

Tony: I used to have fun…

Ned: oh, we KNOW…!

*Peter quickly elbows Ned*

summary: You and Peter dating in college and he comes to your dorm late one night and he’s really hurt and your really worried but after...
question: You and Peter dating in college and he comes to your dorm late one night and he’s really hurt and your really worried but after a while you calm down and say something like, “I’m not studying to be a nurse Parker. You have stop getting hurt”
answer:
“For fuck’s sake, Pete.” You groan, throwing the bloody rag down on the bathroom counter. He winces, droplets of blood still seeping through the wounds.  “I’m not studying to be a nurse. You have stop getting hurt.”

He tries to ignore the sting that doesn’t come from the wounds, but from his heart. But he knew it was true, he relied on you too much to clean him up when he was injured. He would wake you up at ungodly hours of the morning or pull you from your studying and sometimes he’d text you during lectures, dragging you out of the halls.

What he didn’t know was that you just hated seeing him struggle in through your dorm window with blood seeping through the suit and bruises lining his torso because your feelings for him were far beyond friendship and the thought of him continuously getting wounded hurt you more then you wanted to express.

He swallows harshly, ignoring the metallic taste on his tongue. “I’m sorry.” He pushes. “I’m not your responsibility, I know.”

“That’s not what I meant. I mean it’s how it sounded but I just…” You sigh, feeling remorseful. “I hate seeing you hurt, I’d much rather see you happy… uninjured.”

The suit lay discarded on the floor along with the mask and the bruised and bloody boy in front of you looks up from his place on the counter, eyes shining with fresh tears. You assumed the pain killers you kept on hand hadn’t kicked in yet. 

“Being Spider-man makes me happy, you know? Being out there and saving people makes me so happy.”

You extend a hand up, your thumb brushing the small bruises beneath his eye and he hisses gently before resting his cheek in the palm of your hand.

“It’s also wearing you out.” You tell him.

Peter wants to argue with you but he knows taht he’s so tired. He knows that his muscles ache and he’s covered in more bruises then he could count on two hands. 

“Thank you for always taking care of me.” He whispers, voice dry and raspy. He looks so tired with the bags beneath his eyes and as his words begin to slur slightly, you can’t deny the fact that you’re fully prepared to offer him your bed tonight.

“I’ll always take care of you, Pete. But you have to make an effort to take care of yourself too.”
